newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on PTCL selling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on PTCL selling.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Monday as selling in PTCL telecom utility before its book closure on June 10 prompted bearish sentiment, dealers said.

"There are few investors who are interested in the six percent cash dividend announced by the company," a dealer at KAB Securities said, adding that most players opted to square out, setting off a selling spree in the market.
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index fell 16.14 points, or 1.04 percent, to end at 1,531.81. Losers led gainers 208 to 60.
Turnover rose to 57 million shares from Friday's 48 million.

PTCL fell 1.25 rupees to 23.65, ICI Pakistan 0.60 to 23.35, Hub Power 0.50 to 37.15 and Dewan Salman Fibre 1.05 to 34.50. FFC Jordan fell 0.25 to 16.65 and Fauji Fertilizer 1.50 to 82.50. Muslim Commercial Bank rose 0.50 to 34.50.
